alert.note: Alert for Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 7:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, LIBERTY, LONG AND TATTNALL COUNTIES... At 728 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Lanier to 9 miles north of Gumbranch to 6 miles west of Glennville, and moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... Hinesville, Richmond Hill, Glennville, Fort Stewart, Flemington, Gumbranch, Gum Branch, and Donald. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty; Long; Tattnall
